DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Patient Observation Begin Administration Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether the activity of closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment, per protocol guidelines, had begun per protocol guidelines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed._Closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment unless there are changes in test results. Active surveillance avoids problems that may be caused by treatments such as radiation or surgery. It is used to find early signs that the condition is getting worse. During active surveillance, patients will be given certain exams and tests done on a regular schedule. It is sometimes used in prostate cancer._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:Closely monitoring a patient's condition but withholding treatment until symptoms appear or change.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

Closely watching a patient's condition but not giving treatment unless there are changes in test results. Active surveillance avoids problems that may be caused by treatments such as radiation or surgery. It is used to find early signs that the condition is getting worse. During active surveillance, patients will be given certain exams and tests done on a regular schedule. It is sometimes used in prostate cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
